content: The Badge component is used as a status descriptor or numerical value for other UI elements. The content can be a number, string, or a custom React node. It can also be rendered as a dot by setting `isDot`.
Badges can be styled with multiple `colors`, `variants` (solid, flat, faded, shadow), `sizes`, and `shapes` (circle, rectangle). The outline can be disabled with `showOutline={false}`.
The position of the badge relative to its child element is controlled by the `placement` prop, which accepts values like `top-right`, `top-left`, `bottom-right`, and `bottom-left`.
You can programmatically control the visibility of the badge by using the `isInvisible` prop.
The Badge has two stylable slots: `base` (the container) and `badge` (the content wrapper). These can be customized using the `classNames` prop.
It is important not to rely solely on the badge's visual content for meaning. Provide a comprehensive description for screen readers using an `aria-label` on the element the badge is attached to.
